verses.kjv: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
verses.ct: "I tell you the absolute truth: anyone who doesn't come through the gate into the sheep pen but climbs in another way is a thief and a robber.

verses.kjv: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.ct: The one who comes in through the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.

verses.kjv: To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.
verses.ct: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep recognize his voice. He calls each of his own sheep by name and leads them out.

verses.kjv: And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.
verses.ct: Once he has brought out all his own sheep, he walks ahead of them, and they follow because they recognize his voice.

verses.kjv: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.
verses.ct: They will never follow a stranger. Instead, they will run away from him because they don't recognize the voice of strangers."

verses.kjv: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
verses.ct: Jesus told them this illustration, but they didn't understand what he was trying to tell them.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.
verses.ct: So Jesus spoke to them again: "I tell you the absolute truth: I am the gate for the sheep.

verses.kjv: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.
verses.ct: Everyone who came before me was a thief and a robber, but the sheep didn't listen to them.

verses.kjv: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.
verses.ct: I am the gate. Whoever enters through me will be saved. They will come in and go out freely and find pasture.

verses.kjv: The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
verses.ct: A thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I have come so that they can have life — and have it to the fullest.

verses.kjv: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.
verses.ct: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

verses.kjv: But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.
verses.ct: A hired worker who isn't the shepherd and doesn't own the sheep sees a wolf coming and abandons the sheep and runs away. Then the wolf attacks them and scatters the flock.

verses.kjv: The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.
verses.ct: The hired worker runs because he's just working for pay and doesn't actually care about the sheep.

verses.kjv: I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.
verses.ct: I am the good shepherd. I know my sheep, and my sheep know me,

verses.kjv: As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.
verses.ct: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.

verses.kjv: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.
verses.ct: I also have other sheep that are not part of this pen. I must bring them in too, and they will listen to my voice. Then there will be one flock with one shepherd.

verses.kjv: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.
verses.ct: This is why my Father loves me — because I lay down my life so that I can take it up again.

verses.kjv: No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.
verses.ct: No one takes it from me. I lay it down on my own. I have the authority to lay it down, and I have the authority to take it up again. This is the command I received from my Father."

verses.kjv: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
verses.ct: Once again, the Jewish leaders were divided because of what he said.

verses.kjv: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?
verses.ct: Many of them said, "He's possessed by a demon and out of his mind! Why are you even listening to him?"

verses.kjv: Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?
verses.ct: Others said, "These aren't the words of someone possessed by a demon. Can a demon give sight to the blind?"

verses.kjv: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.
verses.ct: Then the Festival of Dedication took place in Jerusalem. It was winter,

verses.kjv: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.
verses.ct: and Jesus was walking in the temple area in Solomon's Porch.

verses.kjv: Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders surrounded him and demanded, "How long are you going to keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, just tell us directly."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, they bear witness of me.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "I already told you, and you didn't believe me. The things I do in my Father's name speak for themselves about who I am.

verses.kjv: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.
verses.ct: But you don't believe because you are not my sheep, as I already told you.

verses.kjv: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
verses.ct: My sheep listen to my voice. I know them, and they follow me.

verses.kjv: And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.
verses.ct: I give them eternal life, and they will never be lost. No one can snatch them out of my hand.

verses.kjv: My Father, which gave them me, is greater than all; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father’s hand.
verses.ct: My Father, who gave them to me, is greater than all, and no one can snatch them out of my Father's hand.

verses.kjv: I and my Father are one.
verses.ct: The Father and I are one."

verses.kjv: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.
verses.ct: Once again the Jewish leaders picked up stones to throw at him.

verses.kjv: Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "I have shown you many good works from the Father. For which of these are you going to stone me?"

verses.kjv: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders answered, "We're not stoning you for any good work, but for blasphemy — because you, a mere man, are claiming to be God."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Isn't it written in your own Law, 'I said, you are gods'?

verses.kjv: If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;
verses.ct: If Scripture called those people 'gods' — the ones to whom God's word came — and Scripture cannot be set aside,

verses.kjv: Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?
verses.ct: then how can you accuse the one whom the Father set apart and sent into the world of blasphemy just because I said, 'I am the Son of God'?

verses.kjv: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.
verses.ct: If I'm not doing the works of my Father, then don't believe me.

verses.kjv: But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in him.
verses.ct: But if I am doing them, even if you don't believe me personally, believe the works themselves. Then you will know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father."

verses.kjv: Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,
verses.ct: They tried to arrest him again, but he slipped away from them.

verses.kjv: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.
verses.ct: He went back across the Jordan River to the place where John had first been baptizing, and he stayed there.

verses.kjv: And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.
verses.ct: Many people came to him and said, "John never performed any miracles, but everything John said about this man turned out to be true."

verses.kjv: And many believed on him there.
verses.ct: And many people in that place put their faith in him.
